intro: Cyrtandra penduliflora var. penduliflora, commonly known as the hanging-flowered cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its pendant inflorescences that bear small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, often brightly colored blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical research.
